benchmark_details.name: MEDFACT (A Large-scale Chinese Dataset for Evidence-based Medical Fact-checking of LLM Responses)
benchmark_details.overview: MEDFACT is the first evidence-based Chinese medical fact-checking dataset for LLM-generated medical content, consisting of 1,321 questions and 7,409 claims, intended to improve the reliability of medical information generated by language models.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a dataset for the evaluation and training of models in the medical fact-checking domain, specifically targeting LLM-generated content.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset is limited to Chinese medical content and exhibits imbalanced label distribution.

data.source: Constructed from medical questions sourced from the webMedQA dataset with LLM-generated responses.
data.annotation: Annotated through an 'LLM-then-Human' approach with independent reviews by trained annotators.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on model predictions against the ground truth veracity labels.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 score signifies better classification of claims into supported and refuted categories.
methodology.validation: Inter-Annotator Agreement measured by Cohenâ€™s Kappa of 81.54%.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: No private information is present in the dataset.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Dataset is shared under the Apache-2.0 license.
